div.br:
April 14th update on distance learning
Hinckley-Finlayson Schools Community-
I want to acknowledge the great work our students, teachers, staff, parents, and school board have done during this difficult time.
For every member of our community I have noticed how people have tried to practice three principles while we are not together in person.
Be patient.
Be kind.
Be understanding.
We have seen students work hard to continue learning, maintain connections, and make the best of a difficult situation. You may notice the pictures on Instagram, facebook, and other media. Our students are learning and getting creative. If you are a student who is struggling or know a student who is struggling please reach out to a classroom teacher, counselor, or principal. We are checking in on those in need via text, e-mail, virtual meetings, or by home visits if needed. Struggling might be academic, social, emotional, or getting basic needs met. We will do our best to support you.
Last night we had our first school board meeting since our schools had a drastic change on March 18th. We tried an experiment with some board members (and presenters) joining us virtually from home, some at Finlayson Elementary, and some at Hinckley-Finlayson High School. It was a challenge but I am proud of our board and all those that attended in various means. We had a somewhat normal meeting and were able to check in on distance learning, programming, and much of our regular school business. The board, and participants, showed great leadership by keeping social distancing and meeting only in small groups.
We had to have some discussions about how to do some special business in unique ways this year. We discussed how we are going to conduct graduation (5/31), senior awards supper (5/13), and staff end of year recognition breakfast (6/5). We did not make any decisions. We did, however, have some good conversations about how we are going to celebrate the class of 2020 and our staff at the end of a most unusual year. At this time we are planning on keeping all events on the planned day and arranging for a safe celebration. I greatly appreciate the Community Education Advisory Committee, Professional Development Committee, Mr. Masterson, and our student board members Allyce Mulder and Avery Degerstrom. The conversation on celebrating our students and staff was thoughtful and hopeful.
We learned some things about virtual meetings and will try again next Monday, 4/20, with a special meeting at 6:30 PM. The agenda item is to set our "capital budget" for 2020- 21. I will also share the ideas that have been taken in about graduation, senior supper, and staff recognition breakfast. If you want to share your thoughts you can e-mail me at rprater@isd2165.org or Brian Masterson at bmasterson@isd2165.org. We will share info with the various committees and school board as a whole. The meeting will be streamed on facebook live on Monday April 20th at 6:30 PM.
#JagsUnited
Rob Prater

div.font: See Video Below for instructions on how to get Remind (text or email notifications) class code for parents is @b49c6 ​​​ ​ ​

div.br:
A rural school district in east-central MN that celebrates learning!
What we offer
We offer students and families a wide range of tools to make their education successful.
Our caring staff is dedicated, passionate and committed. We have a made a promise to our students and families to be "The place where every student is known, valued and challenged to succeed." and everything we do, is done to fulfill that promise.
Early Childhood Education. In order to nurture a life long love of learning, We offer an exceptional preschool program for children (Lets Get Ready for 4 yr olds and ECFE for families with children 0-5.)
Rigorous academic programs. Now offering robotics and engineering programs, as well as College in Schools (CIS), advanced World Language programs and Advanced Placement (AP) coursework to support our students educational growth.
Special Education. Hinckley-Finlayson staff members are experts at helping students with unique challenges develop to their fullest potential.
